intro: Molongum zschokkeiforme, commonly known as the Zschokke's molong, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant has a short, stout stem and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
